pullRequest.title: Properly support JUnit 5 parameters on test methods
pullRequest.bodyText:
This is done by deep-cloning the objects into the TCCL
before actually passing them to the test
Fixes #8251, fixes #8703, fixes #8978

nodes.bodyText: I will move this to the test-bom when CI completes on my fork

nodes.bodyText: I am assuming that having this in tests cause any problems / add any dependencies to the regular application. Is that valid?

commit.message:
Properly support JUnit 5 parameters on test methods

This is done by deep-cloning the objects into the TCCL
before actually passing them to the test

Fixes #8251, fixes #8703, fixes #8978

This is done by deep-cloning the objects into the TCCL
before actually passing them to the test

Fixes #8251, fixes #8703, fixes #8978

afterCommit.message:
Properly support JUnit 5 parameters on test methods

nodes.bodyText:
I don't like this, jboss marshalling has some Cloner support that is likely more appropriate to use here.
Really though if we had support for creating an object without calling a constructor you could just use reflection to recursively clone, but adding this support requires multi release jar support and would prevent Quarkus being build with JDK8.
Ideally we would move non-constructor based instantiation into a mini library, and then do a simple reflection based clone. I probably won't get to look at this today, but I will likely have time later this week.
